an4.175:4.1: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
an4.175:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Upavāṇa sat down to one side,
an4.175:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, are you a terminator because you have knowledge?”
an4.175:7.1: “Are you a terminator because you have conduct?”
an4.175:9.1: “Are you a terminator because you have knowledge and conduct?”
an4.175:11.1: “Are you a terminator because you lack knowledge and conduct?”
an4.175:13.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, when asked whether you’re a terminator because you have knowledge, because you have conduct, because you have knowledge and conduct, or because you lack knowledge and conduct,
an4.175:13.9: How then are you a terminator?”
an4.175:14.1: “Reverend, if you were a terminator because you have knowledge, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.
an4.175:14.2: If you were a terminator because you have conduct, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.
an4.175:14.3: If you were a terminator because you have knowledge and conduct, then even someone who still has grasping could be a terminator.
an4.175:14.4: If you were a terminator because you lack knowledge and conduct, then even an ordinary person could be a terminator.
an4.175:14.5: For an ordinary person lacks knowledge and conduct.
an4.175:14.6: Reverend, someone who does not have good conduct does not know and see things as they are.
an4.175:14.7: Someone accomplished in good conduct knows and sees things as they are.
an4.175:14.8: Knowing and seeing things as they are, one is a terminator.”
